children.name: when a thought comes into your mind
think
children.definition: /θɪŋk/  to have an idea or thought in your mind, especially one that appearssuddenly:
examples: nghĩ ra
▪ What are you thinking right now?
Giờ bạn đang nghĩ gì?
think of
nghĩ đến
▪ I’ve just thought of a really good idea.
Tôi đã nghĩ đến một điều rất hay.
▪ Has she thought of any names for the baby?
Cô ấy có nghĩ đến bất cứ cái tên nào cho đứa bé chưa?
▪ ‘Did you ask Rita?’ ‘No, I didn’t think of that.’
'Bạn có hỏi Rita không?' 'Không, tôi không nghĩ đến điều đó."
think of doing something
nghĩ về gì đó
▪ There was water spraying everywhere, but nobody even thought of turning it off.Ở khắp mọi nơi có phun nước, nhưng không ai nghĩ đến việc tắt máy.
think (that)
nghĩ rằng
▪ I think I’ll go and see what’s happening out there.
Tôi nghĩ tôi sẽ đi xem điều gì đang xảy ra ở đó.

children.name: have an idea
children.definition: /ˌhæv ən aɪˈdɪə/  to think of an idea:có ý kiến
examples: ▪ I have an idea. Why don’t I drive the kids to school and then you can stay here.
Tôi có ý này. Tôi sẽ đưa mấy đứa trẻ đến trường và sau đó bạn có thể ở lại đây.
▪ Let me know if you have any good ideas
Cho tôi biết nếu bạn có bất kỳ ý tưởng nào hay
▪ Theresa had another idea. We would hitchhike to her hometown, and live in her brother’s garage
Theresa có một ý kiến khác. Chúng tôi sẽ đi xe máy về quê cô ấy, và sống trong nhà để xe của anh trai cô.
have an idea for
có ý tưởng về
▪ Collings had an idea for a device that would block out TV programs that parents didn’t want their children to watch.
Collings có ý tưởng về một thiết bị có thể ngăn chặn các chương trình truyền hình mà cha mẹ không muốn con cái họ xem.

children.name: have a thought
children.definition: /ˌhæv ə ˈθɔːt/ spokento think something:nghĩ về
examples: ▪ I’ve just had an awful thought. What if all the banks are closed?
Tôi đã có một suy nghĩ khủng khiếp. Điều gì sẽ xảy ra nếu tất cả các ngân hàng đều đóng cửa?
▪ I had an interesting thought today when I was talking to Anita. Do you realize that she’s never asked us to her house in all the time we’ve known her?
Tôi đã có một suy nghĩ thú vị ngày hôm nay khi tôi nói chuyện với Anita. Bạn có nhận ra rằng cô ấy không bao giờ mời chúng ta đến nhà cô ấy từ khi biết nhau đến giờ?

children.name: cross sb’s mind
children.definition: cross somebody’s mind/ˌkrɒs somebodyˈs ˈmaɪndǁˌkrɔːs-/  if a thought crosses someone’s mind they think about it for a short time:
examples: lướt qua đầu mình
▪ ‘Why didn’t you call me?’ "The thought did cross my mind while I was shopping this afternoon, but then I forgot all about it.
'Tại sao anh không gọi cho tôi?' "Ý nghĩ đó lướt qua đầu tôi trong khi tôi đi mua sắm chiều nay, nhưng sau đó tôi quên hết.
it crossed somebody’s mind that
nghĩ rằng
▪ It crossed my mind that I was the only female coach on the committee, but that made me more determined than ever.
Tôi nghĩ rằng tôi là huấn luyện viên nữ duy nhất trong ủy ban, nhưng điều đó làm cho tôi quyết tâm hơn bao giờ hết.
it crossed somebody’s mind to do something
nghĩ về cái gì đó
▪ Several times it had crossed his mind to check on the car, but he never actually did it.
Một vài lần ông ta nghĩ về việc kiểm tra lại chiếc xe, nhưng ông ấy chưa bao giờ thực sự làm được.
it never crossed somebody’s mind
chưa bao giờ nghĩ đến
▪ ‘It never crossed my mind to give up,’ he said. ‘It became an obsession.’
'Tôi chưa bao giờ nghĩ đến bỏ cuộc,' ông nói. "Nó đã trở thành nỗi ám ảnh."

children.name: occur to
children.partOfSpeech: [transitive phrasal verb not in progressive or passive]
children.definition: /əˈkɜːʳ tuː/  if a new thought occurs to you, you suddenly think it:nghĩ ra
examples: it occurs to somebody that
ai đónghĩ ra rằng
▪ It suddenly occurred to Miranda that perhaps no one would believe her story.
Đột nhiên Miranda nghĩ rằng có lẽ không ai tin câu chuyện của cô.
▪ Didn’t it occur to you that I might be worried?
Bạn không biết tôi lo đến nhường nào sao?
something occurs to somebody
ai đónghĩ ra cái gì đó
▪ The possibility that he might be wrong never occurs to him.
Có khả năng là anh ta không bao giờ nghĩ rằng mình sai.
it occurs to somebody to do something
ai đónghĩ ra cái gì đó để làm
▪ As I thought about Mel and David and how similar they were, it occurred to me to introduce them to each other.
Khi tôi nhớ về việc Mel và David quá giống nhau, tôi đã nghĩ nên giới thiệu chúng với nhau.

children.name: enter sb’s mind
children.definition: if a thought enters sb’s mind, they begin to think about it: nghĩ
examples: it entered sb’s mind that
▪ At that moment it entered my mind that maybe someone was trying to kill him
it entered sb’s mind to do sth
▪ Did it ever enter your mind to take out the garbage?
it never entered sb’s mind
▪ It never entered my mind that Philip might be jealous.

children.name: strike
children.definition: /straɪk/  if a thought or idea strikes you, you suddenly think it, especially because of sth you have just seen or heard:chợt nghĩ ra

children.name: it strikes sb that
examples: ▪ I looked around the glittering room and it struck me that I was probably the poorest person there.

children.name: strike sb as strike adjective
examples: ▪ My mother was always asking questions, and it struck me as odd that she didn’t ask one on this occasion.

children.name: come to mind
children.definition: /spring to mindC2  if sth comes or springs to mind, you suddenly think it, especially in relation to a particular subject that you are considering:đột nhiên nghĩ đến
examples: ▪ As I read the letter again, a number of thoughts came to mind.
▪ Henry asked the first question that came to mind.
▪ I love the circus life, but when people asked me what I wanted to be when I was older, ‘circus performer’ was not what sprang to mind.

children.name: to think about sth before making a decision
think
children.definition: /θɪŋk/
examples: ▪ Give me time to think.
▪ It’s a difficult question. Think carefully before you answer.
think about
▪ I’ve been thinking about how to tell Marcia the bad news.
▪ ‘What are you going to do with your day off?’ ‘I don’t know - I haven’t really thought about it yet.’
think hardthink carefully
▪ You have to think hard and ask yourself, ‘Do I want to give up everything to do this?’
stop to think
▪ You never even stopped to think how this might be affecting your family!

children.name: consider
children.definition: to think about somethingcarefullybeforedecidingwhat to do:đắn đo
examples: ▪ Before buying a car you should consider the cost of insuring it.

children.name: consider doing sth
examples: ▪ Have you considered working as a journalist?

children.name: think over
children.definition: to thinkcarefullyabout an idea, suggestion, or offer beforedecidingwhat to do:cân nhắc, xem xét
examples: ▪ After thinking it over, I’ve decided to accept the offer.
▪ Think over what I told you, and give me your answer when you’re ready.

children.name: think through
children.definition: to think carefully and thoroughly about all the possible results and effects of sth you are doing or plan to do:suy xét
examples: ▪ The government is being criticized for not thinking through the consequences of further tax cuts.
▪ It seems to me the whole plan was very badly thought through.
▪ Before you commit yourself to this contract you should take a couple of hours to think it through.

children.name: give sth some thought
children.definition: alsohave a thinkUK  to spend some time thinking carefully about a question or problem in order to decide what to do:suy nghĩ thấu đáo
examples: My agent really wanted me to do the movie, but after giving it some thought I decided not to.
I’m still not sure what’s the best route to take. I’ll have a think about it tonight.

children.name: sleep on
children.definition: it to delay making a decision about a difficult problem until the next day in order to have more time to think about it: để hôm sau
examples: There’s no obligation to do anything at all. Sleep on it, and tell me what you think in the morning.

children.name: mull over
children.definition: to spend a long time thinking carefully about a plan or idea:nghiền ngẫm
examples: ▪ If you are mulling over the idea of starting a new business, remember that there are many things that can affect your decision.
▪ After almost two decades of mulling it over in his mind, Sayles finally made his Texas movie.

children.name: be under consideration
children.definition: if a plan, request, suggestion etc is under consideration, it is being considered and discussed so that an official decision can be made:
examples: ▪ A new pension plan for employees is now under consideration.
▪ One of the amendments under consideration proposes that all European countries reduce pollution levels by 30%.

children.name: to think about sth you might do in the future
think about
children.definition: / of
examples: ▪ Have you ever thought about a cruise to the Bahamas?

children.name: think about/of doing sth
examples: ▪ I’m thinking of specializing in Russian and Chinese.
▪ We thought about going away for a week or two, but neither of us have time.

children.name: contemplate
children.definition: to think seriously about something important you intend to do in the future - use this especially in written and formal contexts:suy tưởng, suy ngẫm
examples: ▪ Isn’t 17 a little young to be contemplating marriage?

children.name: contemplate doing sth
examples: ▪ Many years ago he had contemplated writing a book about his childhood.
▪ The government was contemplating fining anyone who was found within the island’s danger zone.

children.name: consider
children.definition: /kənˈsɪdəʳ/  to think about something that you might possibly do in the future, but without definitely deciding whether you will do it or not:xem xét
examples: ▪ We began to consider the possibility of moving to Japan permanently.
▪ For any skin problem, it’s worth considering a change of diet.

children.name: consider doing something
examples: ▪ I considered driving out to Atlantic City to meet her.
▪ Have you considered getting a new car?

children.name: toy with the idea of
children.definition: to think about doing sth in the future, but not very seriously because you probably will not do it:
examples: ▪ Lately I’ve been toying with the idea of a trip to South America.

children.name: toy with the idea of doing sth
examples: ▪ He began toying with the idea of writing a book about his years in the FBI.
▪ As late as the age of forty, I toyed with the idea of going back to college.

children.name: to think about the advantages and disadvantages of sth
take stock
children.definition: to think carefully about the situation you are in, and about the way it has developed so far, in order to decide what to do next:suy xét, kiểm điểm
examples: ▪ Between projects, Morrison tries to rest, take stock, and do some gardening for relaxation.

children.name: take stock of
examples: ▪ Now that the crisis is over, it is time to take stock of the political situation in the region.
▪ It’s time to take stock of what our government does and weed out the wasteful and ineffective programs.

children.name: weigh
children.definition: /weigh up  to carefully consider a plan or choice by comparing all the advantages and disadvantages involved, so that you can make a decision: cân nhắc
examples: ▪ I’ve been weighing up all the pros and cons of moving to London.
▪ Investors are weighing their next moves after the stock market climbed to record heights yesterday.

children.name: weigh sth against sth
examples: ▪ After weighing the cost of the new program against supposed benefits, the directors decided to cancel the project.
